notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Application Runtimes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Openshift Application Runtimes provides an application platform that reduces the complexity of developing and operating applications (monoliths and microservices) for OpenShift as a containerized platform.

This release of RHOAR Spring Boot 1.5.16 serves as a replacement for RHOAR Spring Boot 1.5.15, and includes bug fixes and enhancements. For further information, refer to the Release Notes linked to in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* tomcat: A bug in the UTF-8 decoder can lead to DoS (CVE-2018-1336)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Application Runtimes Spring Boot 1.5.16 update

notes.text: An improper handing of overflow in the UTF-8 decoder with supplementary characters can lead to an infinite loop in the decoder causing a Denial of Service. Versions Affected: Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M9 to 9.0.7, 8.5.0 to 8.5.30, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.51, and 7.0.28 to 7.0.86.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2018-1336 tomcat: A bug in the UTF-8 decoder can lead to DoS
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Fuse 6.3 and 7 standalone distributions ship but do not use tomcat, and as such are not affected by this flaw; however, Fuse Integration Services 2.0 and Fuse 7 on OpenShift provide the affected artifacts via their respective maven repositories, and will provide fixes for this issue in a future release.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link (you must log in to download the update).
